skill.name: dast-nuclei
skill.description: Fast, template-based vulnerability scanning using ProjectDiscovery's Nuclei with extensive community templates covering CVEs, OWASP Top 10, misconfigurations, and security issues across web applications, APIs, and infrastructure. Use when: (1) Performing rapid vulnerability scanning with automated CVE detection, (2) Testing for known vulnerabilities and security misconfigurations in web apps and APIs, (3) Running template-based security checks in CI/CD pipelines with customizable severity thresholds, (4) Creating custom security templates for organization-specific vulnerability patterns, (5) Scanning multiple targets efficiently with concurrent execution and rate limiting controls.

security_audit.summary: Documentation-only skill providing guidance for legitimate Nuclei DAST tool. No executable scripts present. Contains standard security documentation with safe credential handling practices and authorization warnings.

content.user_title: Scan web apps for vulnerabilities with Nuclei
content.value_statement: Automated vulnerability scanning identifies security issues in web applications and APIs. Nuclei uses 7000+ community templates to detect CVEs, misconfigurations, and OWASP Top 10 vulnerabilities quickly and accurately.
actual_capabilities: Run automated CVE and vulnerability scans against web applications
Execute template-based security checks with severity filtering
Perform authenticated scanning with Bearer tokens and API keys
Generate SARIF and JSON reports for CI/CD integration
Create custom security templates for organization-specific checks
limitations: Requires Nuclei to be installed separately (go install or Docker)
Does not perform manual penetration testing or exploitation
Template quality depends on community-contributed rules
May produce false positives requiring manual verification

best_practices: Always obtain written authorization before scanning systems you do not own
Use conservative rate limits (50-100 req/s) for production environments
Verify critical findings manually before raising security incidents
anti_patterns: Scanning third-party services without explicit permission
Using high concurrency settings that may overwhelm target applications
Ignoring false positive rates and not validating findings

faq.question: Does this skill install Nuclei?
faq.answer: No, you must install Nuclei separately using go install or Docker as documented.

faq.question: What severity levels does Nuclei support?
faq.answer: Critical, high, medium, low, and info severity levels for filtering findings.

faq.question: Can I integrate this with GitHub Actions?
faq.answer: Yes, use the provided GitHub Actions workflow template with SARIF export for security tab integration.

faq.question: Are my scan results kept private?
faq.answer: Results are stored locally on your system. The skill does not transmit data externally.

faq.question: How do I reduce false positives?
faq.answer: Use severity filtering, exclude tags, and verify findings manually using the false positive guide.

faq.question: How does this compare to other DAST tools?
faq.answer: Nuclei uses template-based scanning for speed and customization. Combine with ZAP or Burp for comprehensive coverage.
